alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 10:02PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Gulf, Liberty, Calhoun and Franklin Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Woodruff L&D, Blountstown... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Ocheessee Landing in Calhoun County is flooded, restricting access to the boat ramp and parking area. Kennedy Creek at Forest Road 115 in Liberty County floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Tuesday /9:15 PM EDT Tuesday/ the stage was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 20.9 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.0 feet on 02/07/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
